intro: Chisocheton curranii, commonly known as the Curran's chisocheton, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed, and it is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
